author: Kim Mackrael
title: Canada’s Trade Deficit Widened In February On Higher Imports
text:
OTTAWA—Canada’s trade deficit widened in February as imports of energy products reached their highest level in more than three years and exports edged up, retracing some of the sharp declines in both categories during the previous month.
Canada posted a trade deficit in February of 2.69 billion Canadian dollars ($2.10 billion), Statistics Canada said Thursday. That was larger than the C$2.1 billion deficit economists expected, according to Royal Bank of Canada.
